titleStmt.title: Britaines honour In the two valiant Welchmen, who fought against fifteene thousand Scots, at their now comming to England passing over Tyne; wherof one was kill'd manfully fighting against his foe, and the other being taken prisoner, is now (upon relaxation) come to Yorke to his Majestie. The tune is, How now Mars, &c.
titleStmt.author: M. P. (Martin Parker), d. 1656?

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by E. G[riffin] and are to be sold [by T. Lambert] at the Horse-Shooe in Smith-field,

notesStmt.note: Signed: M. P., i.e. Martin Parker.
Publisher's name, bookseller's name and publication date from STC.
Describes the events of the siege of Newcastle by the Scots during the Civil Wars.
Imperfect as filmed; the copy on Wing microfilm set, reel 1586, lacks the 2nd part.
Identified as Wing B4811 on UMI microfilm set "Early English books, 1641-1700".
Reproductions of the original in the Bodleian Library.
